TopicTitle: [QUESTION] how many polygons can be on model and node collider?

Articles.Content: To my knowledge, there\'s no solid limit. Though, fewer than 1000 tris per part is a good target for models. The collider should be as few as possible, i.e., a simple cylinder or cube is ideal.

node_collider must be less then 256 polygons

The upper limit on polycount in the mesh is above 20,000 (at that point the part won\'t load) but when you\'re above 5k you\'re probably putting in too much detail even on bigger parts.

Shouldn\'t the limits be in the number of triangles rather than polygons?

Because a rectangle and a hexagon, for instance, won\'t have the same number of triangles, while they are both polygons.
Well yes, though we only deal in triangles and quadrangles
